Name: Amulet of the 'girdle of Isis'
Description: Crudely incised dark blue faience amulet of the Isis knot or 'girdle' (in Egyptian 'tit'). The precise original significance of the knot is uncertain, but it figures in incantations spoken against miscarriage in New Kingdom papyri. As the emblem of Isis, the goddess of healing, it is a common amulet for the protection of the dead.
